questions.question_text: A network engineer is retrofitting an existing building wired with Category 5e with Cisco Aironet 3800 Series APs and mGig switches. Which cable length allows for 5G operation?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Max cable length for 5e rated cable is ~100m

https://tripplite.eaton.com/products/ethernet-cable-types#:~:text=The%20maximum%20length%20of%20a,328%20feet%20or%20100%20meters.

choices.B: Excessive overlapping channels in the 2.4 GHz band exists.
choices.D: TPC drastically reduces Tx power in the 2.4 GHz band.
choices.C: TPC drastically increases Tx power in the 2.4 GHz band.
choices.A: Excessive co-channel interference in the 2.4 GHz band exists.

questions.question_text:
A hospital wireless environment was designed with these characteristics:
• RF coverage
• better than -67 dBm in the 5 GHz spectrum
• RRM be used for DCA and TPC in the 2.4 GHz band
• RRM be used for DCA and TPC in the 5 GHz band

After deployment, why do many of the legacy 802.11b/g devices have difficulty maintaining connectivity?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct. Considering these are legacy 802.11b/g devices, they may have less sensitive receivers so if TPC reduces TxP too much in 2.4 GHz, the result is insufficient signal strength causing them to be unable to maintain strong enough connection to the APs.

comments.content: There's RRM configured here w/c helps manage CCI rather than cause connectivity issues.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Option A is more likely because co-channel interference directly impacts connectivity by increasing noise and contention, while TPC adjustments (Option D) are typically controlled to maintain adequate coverage.

questions.question_text: A customer has a Cisco wireless network that supports VoWLAN services. The customer wants supported voice clients to receive roaming recommendations and suggestions from APs. This functionality must not impact non-VoWLAN clients. What should be enabled on the VoWLAN SSID?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
802.11r can be done in one WLAN SSID.

Selected Answer: C
Cisco Centralized Key Management (CCKM) provides for faster client roaming for Extensible
Authentication Protocol (EAP)-authenticated client, which benefits call quality.

Selected Answer: B
ccnp-enwlsd pag 178 optimizing with 802.11k - "as long client also supports 802.11k, the APs and controllers can interact with it to SEGGEST the need roam, as well as a list of know-good candidate APs it can roam to."
Answer:D

questions.question_text: An engineer is designing a network deployment for a technology company. The company has four buildings with access points that must provide seamless wireless coverage and client roaming. The customer data center must have two WLCs and the core switches for the network. Which type of wireless architecture must be used?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is the right choice

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A customer is deploying a Greenfield 802.11n network with data, voice, and location awareness using APs with the WSSI modules. Which two settings in the Cisco Prime Infrastructure Planning Tool, when selected, provide a more accurate prediction of the number of APs the customer must purchase for the new facility? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
B and E are right choices

Selected Answer: BE
Answer is B & E.

Override Coverage per AP (A) is used to specify sqft coverage as the basis for AP coverage while Data/Coverage (C) is the default and is used for Data Only WLAN to specify densities, depending on the band and data rates. Therefore, these are not the correct answers.

The APs are installed with WSSI w/c renders the Location with Monitor Mode APs (D) incorrect.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/net_mgmt/prime/infrastructure/3-1-TP/user/guide/pi_ug/wireless-maps.html
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/wireless/aironet-3600-series/115612-Aironet-Access-Point-Module-for-WSSI-Guide-00.html#AD

Selected Answer: BE
Voice and location only, no monitoring mode needed.

The WSSI module is a specialized radio that transfers monitoring and security services from the client/data serving radios to the security monitor module. This results in improved client performance and cost reduction by eliminating the necessity for dedicated monitor mode access points

Selected Answer: BE
chat gpt said B E

B & D are correct,

The options B. Voice and D. Location with Monitor Mode APs are the most suitable for the described scenario as they effectively address all the critical needs of the network: data support, voice, and precise location tracking. so, Ithink these options should meet the requirements outlined in the question.

Selected Answer: AB
Select the Voice check box, if voice traffic is transmitted on the wireless LAN.
